verses.verse: Now Pashhur<WH6583>, the son<WH1121> of Immer<WH564> the priest<WH3548>, who was chief<WH6496> officer<WH5057> in the house<WH1004> of Jehovah<WH3068>, heard<WH8085> Jeremiah<WH3414> prophesying<WH5012> these things<WH1697>.

Then Pashhur<WH6583> smote<WH5221> Jeremiah<WH3414> the prophet<WH5030>, and put<WH5414> him in the stocks<WH4115> that were in the upper<WH5945> gate<WH8179> of Benjamin<WH1144>, which was in the house<WH1004> of Jehovah<WH3068>.

And it came to pass on the morrow<WH4283>, that Pashhur<WH6583> brought forth<WH3318> Jeremiah<WH3414> out of the stocks<WH4115>. Then said<WH559> Jeremiah<WH3414> unto him<WH3068>, Jehovah hath not called<WH7121> thy name<WH8034> Pashhur<WH6583>, but Magor-missabib<WH4036>.

For thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>, Behold<WH5414>, I will make thee a terror<WH4032> to thyself<WH157>, and to all thy friends; and they shall fall<WH5307> by the sword<WH2719> of their enemies<WH341>, and thine eyes<WH5869> shall behold<WH7200> it<WH5414>; and I will give all Judah<WH3063> into the hand<WH3027> of the king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894>, and he shall carry them captive<WH1540> to Babylon<WH894>, and shall slay<WH5221> them with the sword<WH2719>.

Moreover I will give<WH5414> all the riches<WH2633> of this city<WH5892>, and all the gains<WH3018> thereof<WH3366>, and all the precious things thereof<WH214>, yea, all the treasures of the kings<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063> will I give<WH5414> into the hand<WH3027> of their enemies<WH341>; and they shall make them a prey<WH962>, and take<WH3947> them<WH935>, and carry them to Babylon<WH894>.

And thou<WH6583>, Pashhur, and all that dwell<WH3427> in thy house<WH1004> shall go<WH3212> into captivity<WH7628>; and thou shalt come<WH935> to Babylon<WH894>, and there thou shalt die<WH4191>, and there shalt thou be buried<WH6912>, thou<WH157>, and all thy friends, to whom thou hast prophesied<WH5012> falsely<WH8267>.

O Jehovah<WH3068>, thou hast persuaded<WH6601> me<WH6601>, and I was persuaded; thou art stronger<WH2388> than I<WH3201>, and hast prevailed: I am become a laughing-stock<WH7814> all the day<WH3117>, every one mocketh me<WH3932>.

For as often<WH1767> as I speak<WH1696>, I cry<WH7121> out<WH2199>; I cry<WH7121>, Violence<WH2555> and destruction<WH1697>! because the word of Jehovah<WH3068> is made a reproach<WH2781> unto me<WH7047>, and a derision, all the day<WH3117>.

And if I say<WH559>, I will not make mention<WH2142> of him<WH1696>, nor speak any more in his name<WH8034>, then there is in my heart<WH3820> as it were a burning<WH1197> fire<WH784> shut up<WH6113> in my bones<WH6106>, and I am weary<WH3811> with forbearing<WH3557>, and I cannot contain<WH3201>.

For I have heard<WH8085> the defaming<WH1681> of many<WH7227>, terror<WH4032> on every side<WH5439>. Denounce<WH5046>, and we will denounce<WH5046> him<WH582>, say all my familiar friends<WH8104>, they that watch for my fall<WH6763>; peradventure he will be persuaded<WH6601>, and we shall prevail<WH3201> against him<WH3947>, and we shall take our revenge on him<WH5360>.

But Jehovah<WH3068> is with me as a mighty<WH1368> one<WH6184> and a terrible<WH7291>: therefore my persecutors shall stumble<WH3782>, and they shall not prevail<WH3201>; they shall be utterly<WH3966> put to shame<WH954>, because they have not dealt wisely<WH7919>, even with an everlasting<WH5769> dishonor<WH3639> which shall never be forgotten<WH7911>.

But <WH3068>, O Jehovah of hosts<WH6635>, that triest<WH974> the righteous<WH6662>, that seest<WH7200> the heart<WH3629> and the mind<WH3820>, let me see<WH7200> thy vengeance<WH5360> on them<WH1540>; for unto thee have I revealed my cause<WH7379>.
Sing <WH7891> unto Jehovah<WH3068>, praise<WH1984> ye Jehovah<WH3068>; for he hath delivered<WH5337> the soul<WH5315> of the needy<WH34> from the hand<WH3027> of evil-doers<WH7489>.
Cursed <WH779> be the day<WH3117> wherein I was born<WH3205>: let not the day<WH3117> wherein my mother<WH517> bare<WH3205> me be blessed<WH1288>.
Cursed <WH779> be the man<WH376> who brought tidings<WH1319> to my father<WH1>, saying<WH559>, A<WH2145> man-child<WH1121> is born<WH3205> unto thee<WH8055>; making him very glad<WH8055>.

And let that man<WH376> be as the cities<WH5892> which Jehovah<WH3068> overthrew<WH2015>, and repented<WH5162> not<WH8085>: and let him hear a cry<WH2201> in the morning<WH1242>, and shouting<WH8643> at noontime<WH6256>;
because he slew<WH4191> me not from the womb<WH7358>; and so my mother<WH517> would have been my grave<WH6913>, and her womb<WH7358> always<WH5769> great<WH2030>.
Wherefore came I forth<WH3318> out of the womb<WH7358> to see<WH7200> labor<WH5999> and sorrow<WH3015>, that my days<WH3117> should be consumed<WH3615> with shame<WH1322>?
